docs.lead_paragraph: We need the equivalent of the EpiPen for snakebite.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Dr Matthew Lewin warns of danger annual monsoons in India pose due to venomous snakes seeking dry ground; contends that public health organizations pay surprisingly little attention to scourge of snake bites, which account for 94,000 deaths per year around the globe; maintains much more needs to be done.
docs.snippet: We need the equivalent of the EpiPen for snakebite.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Hillary Rodham Clinton contemplates another run for the presidency, few topics receive more scrutiny than her health, turning tabloid attention to the doctor who advises her and the former president.

headline.seo: Dr. Mark Hyman: Advising the Clintons on Their Health
headline.main: He Tells the Clintons How to Lose a Little
headline.print_headline: He Tells the Clintons How to Lose

docs.abstract: Tabloid attention has turned to diet and nutrition expert Dr Mark Hyman, adviser to Bill and Hillary Clinton, as Hillary contemplates second run for presidency and her health comes under scrutiny.
docs.snippet: As Hillary Rodham Clinton contemplates another run for the presidency, few topics receive more scrutiny than her health, turning tabloid attention to the doctor who advises her and the former president.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers who have fought for years to get full data on Roche's flu medicine Tamiflu said on Thursday that governments who stockpile it are wasting billions of dollars on a drug whose effectiveness is in doubt.

headline.main: Stockpiles of Roche Tamiflu Drug Are Waste of Money, Review Finds
headline.print_headline: Stockpiles of Roche Tamiflu Drug Are Waste of Money, Review Finds

docs.snippet: Researchers who have fought for years to get full data on Roche's flu medicine Tamiflu said on Thursday that governments who stockpile it are wasting billions of dollars on a drug whose effectiveness is in doubt.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court panel on Tuesday issued an injunction blocking new Arizona abortion restrictions that are considered the most stringent in the nation, saying women likely would suffer irreparable harm if the rules are allowed to take effect.

headline.main: Court Extends Stay on New Arizona Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: Court Extends Stay on New Arizona Abortion Rules

docs.snippet: A federal appeals court panel on Tuesday issued an injunction blocking new Arizona abortion restrictions that are considered the most stringent in the nation, saying women likely would suffer irreparable harm if the rules are allowed to take effect.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Metro-North employee involved in a fatal accident was found to have an undiagnosed sleep apnea condition.

headline.main: Sleep Disorder and Schedule Change Cited as Possible Factors in Train Derailment
headline.print_headline: Sleep Disorder and Schedule Change Cited as Possible Factors in Train Derailment

docs.abstract: National Transportation Safety Board offers possible medical explanation for fatal Metro-North accident on Dec 1, 2013, just north of Spuyten Duyvil station in the Bronx; train operator William Rockefeller underwent a sleep study conducted by a board certified sleep medicine physician after saying he was in a 'daze' as train gained speed, results of which indicate that he may suffer from undiagnosed severe obstructive sleep apnea.
docs.snippet: A Metro-North employee involved in a fatal accident was found to have an undiagnosed sleep apnea condition.
